website_summaries.verdict: Easy installation and portability make using it fast and simple at home or while traveling. Small enough to carry in your pocket.
pros: Roku app allows use of voice searches
cons: Sometimes drops off WiFi and doesn't stream 4K
Remote can't be used for motion gaming

website_summaries.verdict: The new Roku Streaming Stick is the best value in streaming-video hardware, period.
pros: The $50 Roku Streaming Stick is one of the least expensive devices to stream video from Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, HBO, Sling TV and other online services
It's just as responsive as other devices -- meaning it's lightning-fast -- and an updated app lets you listen via your phone's headphone jack
Roku's ecosystem offers more apps, better search and more customization than any other
cons: No Ethernet port means it only works via Wi-Fi, not a wired connection
Some app interfaces are less polished than on rival devices
Private listening feature loses lip-sync with some Bluetooth headphones

customer_reviews.title: you will see that most of the bad reviews are related to the remote
customer_reviews.text: If you read the negative reviews on amazon as well as Googling the problems with this product, you will see that most of the bad reviews are related to the remote. It's absolutely horrible. The loss of connection from the device to the remote control is an ongoing problem. I'm surprised that no one has started a class action suit against Roku because of the many consumers that have experienced the same issues. Thank God for the great customer service for replacing this item under warranty. My only concern is that I will have the same problem again.
customer_reviews.author: The Whistler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It work tremendously good. I'm so happy with my Roku
customer_reviews.author: Jaime K.

customer_reviews.title: The Streaming Stick is my favorite device for the reasons below
customer_reviews.text: I currently have a Roku 2, 3, Express and Streaming Stick hooked up across my house. No TV is 4k so I don't have need for the higher end models at the moment. The Streaming Stick is my favorite device for the reasons below: 1. Aim anywhere remote! 2. Quad core processor: Excellent performance and response! 3. Private listening with smartphone: No disturbing family with late night TV watching! The 2 is a fine device, but the aim anywhere remote is wonderful. The 3 is just as great as the Stick but it's harder to hide. If I had a do-over I'd pass on the Express. it's serviceable, but some apps just churn. Specifically, Sling TV.
customer_reviews.author: James H

customer_reviews.title: Beware purchase with HDMI ports at the back of set - potential interference.
customer_reviews.text: Beware purchase with HDMI ports at the back of set, interference is likley. This product has VERY LOW functionality with our older model panasonic TV. Remote works for brief period (GREAT speed and functionality when connected), then cannot be "woken". We were told to removing batteries to reset connection, but it's silly to have to remove batteries every 5 minutes and wait a min+ for reconnection. We ordered free extender and it did not help at all. Perhaps newer models address this SUPER frustrating issue. We're downgrading to express, which has a box, to see if it improves the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Goose

customer_reviews.title: Good device with a couple minor issues.
customer_reviews.text: Overall good device. It offers many options for tv viewing and the interface is easy to navigate. Only a couple issues keep it from getting a 5 star review... -The remote loses connectivity somewhat frequently and the device can be slow at times. Honestly though, I end up using my phone for a remote most times. -Also the unit gets pretty hot but that's probably normal. I still really like the stick and I'll probably be purchasing another one. The only reason I'd go this route over the fire stick is HBO go. Other than that, I'm not brand loyal.
customer_reviews.author: RLCC

customer_reviews.title: Awful Engineering and Gets SO HOT--Run Away From This!
customer_reviews.text: Despite having requested the extension that is offered free by Roku in the pamphlet on the very day that this item arrived and did not fit, the "free" extension they offer in the pamphlet to remedy a common problem never arrived after a 3-week wait. I am returning this item. I have a 1 year-old higher-end tv I use in a smaller room but this "stick" does not work or fit when you actually plug it in to the charger. It fits fine without a power source--poor engineering to not plan for a plug in to power it. Frankly, it became so hot anyway that I want to avoid any hazard that I fear will come from this item.
customer_reviews.author: AnnTop Contributor: Watercolor Painting

customer_reviews.title: It works; not great but it works. Probably would work better if ROKU answered specific questions other than FAQs!
customer_reviews.text: While this Roku Streaming Stick works, I sure with ROKU was as receptive with its customers as Amazon is. I wish I understood enough to switch over to Amazon's device instead of Roku. Don't expect EVER to get any decent response from ROKU's Customer Service. If you go to their site & try to CONTACT CUSTOMER SUPPORT--You'll spend the entire time filling out check-boxes which after 10 minutes, you'll find yourself back at the beginning of the home page. They don't provide answers to ANY QUESTION that's not covered in the FAQs. To me, that's FALSE ADVERTISING!
customer_reviews.author: FarleyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: very nice little gadget...works with an older big screen with hdmi inputs.....free channels are great...youtube is fun....
customer_reviews.text: for the price...this is a VERY FUN MEDIA TOY...I LOVE GETTING YOUTUBE and listening to my albums ON MY OLD BIGSCREEN TV.....HUZZAH ...I LIKE IT...EASY SET UP.....my one qwibble is that you have to go to your laptop to enter pass codes to get certain stations....annnnd finding the FREE STATIONS is difficultish...and they dont even mention...uhmmm..i think they may be called private channels, i forget...those are interesting if short lived at times.....there was a space channel i discovered that wasn't advertised on the roku list....for example......but..i think it went to pay rather than free... oh well.....my used stick worked / is working fine.....you dont have to point at it unlike my stupid old tv remote....
customer_reviews.author: alan LABUDDE

customer_reviews.title: Immortal Battery
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is immortal for some reason. Never had to replace it in 10 months. The software however on South East Asia has very few channel choices. That's not much of a problem to me because YouTube, Netflix, and Plex are all I need. Would love to have Spotify though and some other premium channels. Dropped remote a lot but never broke down. Another caveat is that the remote is so easy to press. Since it uses its own wireless tech, it doesn't need an IR blaster. You will experience a lot of accidental presses if you do not keep this away. Maybe a lock function would be nice on future products.
customer_reviews.author: Chakigun

customer_reviews.title: Download the ap - use phone for remote
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to set up for this novice, seemed pretty fool proof actually. I downloaded the Roku ap and my phone works perfectly to control the tv. I'd have given 5 stars if the remote shipped with the product had worked more than ONE time. First use upon setting up worked as expected so I thought the other comments I had read here must have had something different than what came with my Roku. Nope, it hasn't worked since the first time. That is what I had expected so I wasn't surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fast Uninterrupted Streaming!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with Roku. Excellent streaming with NO interruptions. I went from using a Sony Blue Ray player which was the best at the time, but it often stopped streaming right in the middle of a show or movie I was watching. A friend of mine who works in the A/V and custom home theater business recommended I switch to Roku. He was right...fast streaming with no interruptions. I've only been using it for a couple of weeks so I haven't explored the other options and channels available yet. I understand it's great with Amazon Prime video, too, and I guess I'll sign up for that soon.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Crap customer service, faulty material.
customer_reviews.text: Used to love Roku. This was my fourth roku purchased. Then they changed customer service and decided that not everyone deserved customer service. They straight up will not speak with you unless you purchased a very specific version of the roku. My second roku purchased had a faulty remote and they replaced it. The reason I like them before, easy customer service, Now my 3rd and 4th also have faulty remotes but they are refusing to speak with me because I didn't spend enough of their product. Instead they tell me I have to spend $29 on the replacement remote when I spend $29 on the entire package....
customer_reviews.author: nagromd

customer_reviews.title: Terrific simple device for viewing all your subscription service streaming video.
customer_reviews.text: I only have two criticisms of this device: When pressing pause and then play, the sound and the picture are always off; very noticeably so. The only way I have found to fix it is to press the left arrow to go back 10 seconds. I love the simplicity and minimized buttons, but I do wish it had buttons that could be programmed to control the volume of my sound bar. As a consequence I have to deal with 3 different remotes: TV, Sound bar, and ROKU. What I love: The simplicity. Did I mention the simplicity? Oh, and the simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Makinitwork

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item for traveling!
customer_reviews.text: bought this for hotel use when we travel. Most hotels have the in-house system so they don't offer an HDMI option. However, if you are clever and can move your way around the back of a TV set, or calling the IT person in the hotel (if it is a larger property) you can always make this work. We love it! It has worked great and fun to have our Roku movies and TV shows always with us, rather than accepting what a hotel offers. I highly recommend this Roku Streaming Stick. Well worth the money. We don't leave home without it.
customer_reviews.author: Island Gal

customer_reviews.title: Needs updating
customer_reviews.text: The voice is not on this device (and we do not need) and the user interface sucks.......... Need a larger controller such as those by comcast with numbers and dedicated buttons for certain operations. Just try to get rid of the voice menu when you have no idea how it got turned on! A functional keypad would help with entering passwords and account info instead of going up-down-left-right continuously. As this is simply and interface device, I do not wish to pay large amounts of money for a device lacking user interface (money and costs are ALWAYS a factor in ALL purchases).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Roku Streaming Stick
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Roku stick. I bought one several months ago and I liked it so much, I bought another one for another TV. This is one of the few streaming sticks that offers all the major streaming services ( I need VUDU, Netflix, Amazon, and Hulu). Also, because I subscribe to HBO and Starz through my cable provider, I can watch these on my Roku stick as well without any additional fees. I also like the games and apps features. I am very happy with this product and would strongly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Picnic

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I see lots of people have issues with the remote no longer working? I've had it around 2.5 months and so far it has worked flawlessly. Roku remotes are the best feeling-in-the-hand remotes i've ever used. The app is great and consistent. I have the slowest possible internet that is considered 'high speed,'--that is-- the slowest beyond dial up (does that still exist? i guess in rural parts). It's WAY slower than the slowest speed Netflix recommends to run their service, and this streams flawlessly with no hiccups. I hope I don't get the dreaded remote malfunction. In the meantime, I couldn't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Jmbsol

customer_reviews.title: Roku is amazing. There are so many viewing options to choose ...
customer_reviews.text: Roku is amazing. There are so many viewing options to choose from. Although I do pay for streaming services, with Roku, I don't have to but can still have an unlimited amount of content to watch. I would give it a higher score but the remote did not last very long. After only 2 months, it stopped working. Fortunately, the Roku app is above and beyond a better way to search and view content. Via the app, you can conduct voice searches, find movies and/or tv shows on different apps and divert sound from your tv to your phone.
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike my other streaming device, this one gets "hung up" and once a series ends, the back button will not go back and whatever new series they are touting starts to play and there is no rhyme or reason as to how to make it stop. I have to try everything (Turn TV, Roku, net router off/on) and none of those seem to work. I am not into conspiracy theories but because it only happens to what show is being advertised, is it a forced preview or is that just crazy? Since it never happened on my other device................
customer_reviews.author: Life Is Short

customer_reviews.title: Works great, for the first year
customer_reviews.text: Exactly a year after purchase (of course the warranty is expired) my Roku is constantly disconnecting itself from my wireless network (the router sits right beside the TV by the way). It’s ridiculously frustrating, I’ll be in the middle of a show or sports game and a notification pops up that it’s not connected to the internet. I have to go in and set up a new connection like it doesn’t even remember the wireless network I have saved on it. I love the features and channels available and how easy it is to work the Roku but good lord the internet issue is too much to handle. Worked perfectly up until the year mark.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyGail

customer_reviews.title: Make your dumb TV smart with this Roku stick!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Roku stick! this is the 5th one I've purchased. (2 for household, 1 for work, and 2 as gifts). Definitely loving the 2016 model, seems quicker and easier to handle than the 2014 model, and the 1080 display works great on my 32inch tv. I use the casting option a lot and i use the screen mirroring pretty much everyday at work. It makes showing my students videos, music, reading material etc, very easy. Affordable enough that I can replace it when it starts to wear down. So far the average for ours are between 2.5 to 3 years. Pretty great for a $50 or less product that I use literally everyday!
customer_reviews.author: 'AKL

customer_reviews.title: Saves money over cable, however streaming image of NHL hockey is not the same
customer_reviews.text: This product opened the door to cut the cable TV and save money. I was a bit disappointed with the quality of image when watching NHL hockey though Sling TV. I though this device was good for 60 fps (frames per second). Not sure if this is due to Slings offering or a limitation of the device though. We also bought a Roku Express and have yet to hook it up and compare. I'm also going to talk to Sling support to see how many (fps) they are feeding us.
customer_reviews.author: bea

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed. Remote would not sync with the stick
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. Remote would not sync with the stick. Called company and the sent a new remote. New remote wouldn't sync. Called company and they wanted ME to send back paying the postage. Also very rude when I asked for them to send me shipping label. Still have product that DOESN'T work!!!!
customer_reviews.author: mamer1961

customer_reviews.title: I love this Roku stick
customer_reviews.text: I love this Roku stick. It boots up pretty quickly which is good. I am also a huge fan of the remote since it does not require line-of-sight. I noticed the stick gets pretty hot to the touch when left it's on so I use the microUSB cable and plug the stick into a USB port in the television (instead of plugging into a wall outlet) for power. That way when I turn off the television, the Roku turns off as well and keeps it from staying hot overnight. I wish the four pre-set buttons could be customized to open apps of my choosing, but I'm guessing that real estate was paid for by each company.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey Poo

customer_reviews.title: Roku exceeds the Amazon stick in remote control performance and connectivity.
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple generations of Roku and 2 of these sticks. I also have an Amazon stick. I like this significantly more than the Amazon stick. They both provide the same capabilities aside from the voice input on the Amazon remote, however, the Amazon remote has always been tricky. Sometimes you have to be right next to the stick for the remote to work. Kind of defeats the purpose of a remote. The Roku remote is far ahead in performance. I can access the three online media sources that I use the most, Amazon Prime, Netflix, and Sling TV. If your choice is between this an the Amazon stick, choose the Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Virginiafamily

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a DVD player with some kind of Netflix access built in. It was impossible to use, just really slow and glitchy. It took me years to try another device along those lines... The Roku Streaming Stick is amazing! Compact and portable. Easy set-up. SO many platforms ("channels") (I love that I can get my HBO Go, Starz, even regular cable channels like TBS, with just one initial sign-in through my cable provider). Plus the global search feature lets me search for ANYTHING I want, and it gives me all of the availability options and their respective prices. It works fast and intuitively, including being able to use my phone as a remote. I am very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: K. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1037 Days
customer_reviews.text: Lasted a little over 34 months. One day I got an error message about insufficient power, swapped the usb plug and it was good for another 24 hours then abruptly died. I'm disappointed in the lifespan but it was a good Roku during that time. My Roku 2 lasted a lot longer but the interface became gradually slower with each software update until I gave up on it out of frustration. I switched to a Firestick which seems to be clearer and higher res although they should be the same in theory, but I like the Roku interface better.
customer_reviews.author: R.A.M.Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: AM I HAPPY?
customer_reviews.text: After having great success with 2 Roku 3600R HD Streaming Sticks, I purchased 2 (more) of the Roku Premiere 4K UHD Streaming Media Players. Now all 4 of our TVs are on Rokus! No Cable anymore. Bought (thru Amazon) a Tablo unit, got a Playstation Vue subscription, Aris Modem & Apple Airport Express Extreme WiFi Router...an attic installed "Antenna Direct HD" antenna...now our 4 Rokus provide our HDTV channel needs perfectly...never a problem either...they work like a charm. ...am I happy with my 4 Roku's...what do you think?
customer_reviews.author: William C. Trussell

customer_reviews.title: This stick works great when it will actually connect to my wifi.
customer_reviews.text: A week after buying this I ended up getting a replacement because it stopped connecting to our wifi. It claims to be connected with a strong signal and yet no streaming services work. When refreshing the wifi. '...the internet' icon circles around and finally goes green. I've reset my router and this stick. I guess I will have to send it back again. Luckily I bought a warranty. This stick works great when it will actually connect to my wifi. I live in a large city and am a Comcast subscriber and I am typing this review connected to my wifi and yet the stick isn't connecting.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Roku is great, but their point-anywhere remote is not.
customer_reviews.text: Only issue is the remote. Point-anywhere remote uses WiFi which is automatically configured between the remote and the stick. This connection is susceptible to interference causing very annoying un-pairing well documented since the unit's release. Also purchased a Roku Premiere and I'm happier with the regular infrared remote. Other option is to use your phone, but it'd be better if it just worked right in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Rob M.

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the competition.
customer_reviews.text: I own a Chromecast (my preferred stream stick), the, and now this. The Roku appealed to me because I thought it would play Amazon Prime (unlike the chromecast), and do a good job playing media from my NAS (it's... fine?). The roku hardware is OK (the branded buttons (Hulu/etc.) on the remote are my main complaint). It's the software that really feels clunky on the Roku. The official Roku software feels dated, and the 3rd party stuff is worse. Netflix on the Roku is not as nice as it is with the Chromecast or Amazon Fire Stick.
customer_reviews.author: C. Matheson

customer_reviews.title: We were initially very pleased with our first stick but after several months it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is our second streaming stick. We were initially very pleased with our first stick but after several months it seemed to hit a wall and failed to respond. We tried several remedies (e.g. unplugging everything, removing the stick from the USB port on our TV, etc.) with no success. So after reading reviews various places we decided to purchase a second Roku Streaming Stick. It works almost flawlessly so far. I say "almost" because we still get a weak signal message now and then but have learned to work around it and with a few simple and quick adjustments it is back on beam. Both sticks were easy to install and both allow us a clean uncluttered look.
customer_reviews.author: Gee Whiz

customer_reviews.title: I have had the roku stick for a few days ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had the roku stick for a few days now. The first day I had it right after setting all the channels up I went to Netflix after using plex and it stalled at 25 percent and the screen started flashing between Netflix and home. I unplugged it and it was factory reset once I plugged it back in. The next day it did the same thing after plex and loading Netflix. It's certainly newer and faster than the old roku but seems less stable. Will probably throw it in a drawer and use the old roku.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty good for the first few months, and then started going down hill - At 6 months, it's barely worth trying to use d/t problems with freezing up while streaming. Even when new, this is not an impressive device. Not only does it look cheap, but searching, fast forwarding and navigating are awkward and unsophisticated. I'd have to give this a "do not buy", as there are better and more sophisticated options out there
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: Has some minor drawbacks but overall worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was very easy, the only problem encountered was the TV we wanted it on requires an HDMI extender, had to order one from support, it should be here in a few days, Set everything up on a smaller TV and discovered that the menus are very small so it it really best for larger main room TVs, got channels that we wanted and verification with your cable subscription happens for each of the channels, would be nice if you could verify once and the device would remember. Makes it much easier to watch missed shows the day after they air than waiting for our terrible cable company to add them to the on-demand menus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roku is the king of streaming devices for a reason
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my 3rd Streaming Stick--I love these!!! I have one of the first generation purple sticks and that is still going strong, but recently added a theater to my basement as well as a TV to my gym. What a better solution than to simply add a couple more Streaming Sticks to the house? These are perfect and actually a tad faster than the older generation. Being USB powered is of course a great feature, as many TVs have USB ports, thus these can be powered up with your TV. If you don't have USB, it comes with an adapter--Roku always seems to have everything covered. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Device is OK, iOS app is useless
customer_reviews.text: The device itself is good, seems fairly responsive. The ROKU app, however, is completely useless. Sure, it duplicates what you can do with the included remote, but my main reason fro getting the iOS app was to use an actual keyboard for YouTube searches, etc... however what you type on the app never actually reaches the ROKU device... This was the case several months ago, and still is today...??? they either don't test their stuff or don't bother to fix issues.
customer_reviews.author: Doof

customer_reviews.title: Two Roku devices stopped working properly almost at the same time.
customer_reviews.text: I have two Roku 3600R devices. Both worked fine for a while. And both stopped working properly almost at the same time. Usually I watch some Youtube videos using Roku. Before I could watch different videos, short and long (movies), from few minutes to few hours. Now I cannot do that anymore. Both Roku units suddenly and randomly jump to Roku home page in several minutes after I start watching. It can be 10 minutes or 20 minutes or more or less. And in order to continue watching I have to make several clicks to navigate to where it stopped. Sometimes it is not even possible to navigate to stopping point so I have to search and start all other.
customer_reviews.author: Garik Syhoi

customer_reviews.title: Roku Stick Is A Great Addition To Your TV
customer_reviews.text: Roku is easy to set up and has some great channels. I originally bought it because my 4K Tv doesn't have Bluetooth and the Roku iPhone all let's you use your Bluetooth headphones. It works perfectly but then I explored the channels! Wow! I have Fire TV on my other set and they both have merit. Glad I have both. Still the Bluetooth listening capability on Roku is tough to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Carr

customer_reviews.title: Best Roku model for streaming for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Roku and it is such a better streamer than the first Roku model I purchased. I originally started out with the Roku Express, it was the cheapest one. I was having problems with streaming, it would work for 1 hour and then it would just keep loading and interrupting viewing. Decided to upgrade to the Roku Streaming Stick which has wi fi built in and a quad core processor, so it holds more memory while streaming. I highly recommend getting this model or above. It's worth the extra money. No streaming lag, no overheating, the best Roku model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic device! I've used Chromecast and Apple TV and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic device! I've used Chromecast and Apple TV and this is better than both. My favorite feature is the Xfinity Streaming App. You can download the free (for now) app in the Roku app store and it replaces the need for a cable box. The app actually becomes your cable box. You can watch all of your Xfinity channels as well as any On Demand or DVR shows you have saved in another Xfinity DVR. I wish I had found this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Problems developed over time...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not too happy with this Roku. We also have a Roku3 and it is much better. Everything was fine for the first month but we are slowly seeing more and more problems. The remote on this is very frustrating and does not always work. The device also freezes frequently which I find very odd. I have had to unplug it several times as it overheats easily. Wish I could return it but unfortunately I am outside of the return window so we will just have to deal with it for now before either purchasing another Roku 3 or a Fire Stick.
customer_reviews.author: Mika

customer_reviews.title: lousy customer service
customer_reviews.text: I've replaced this once already. The replacement keeps burning out new batteries and the ONLY way to get customer service is to pay $22. The guy (in India?) won't believe the thing is burned out (no red light when new batteries inserted) and I am sick of arguing with him. Not sure what to do.
customer_reviews.author: maki-mom

customer_reviews.title: no better than the cheaper unit
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance and purchased a newer and more expensive roku unit. I've been using roku for years, but wondered if a "better" unit would improve my experience. There are some differences between my old and new unit, but they are quite minor and I don't see that it improves my experience. It certainly doesn't seem to bring the item I wish to view up any faster; if anything, perhaps a bit slower. Nor is the picture noticeably better, though it is no worse. I would say if you can save even $10 by buying a lower level unit, then you should do so.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C

customer_reviews.title: Good, but dont expect blazing speeds :)
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have a Roku in my home office. I have mine hooked up to the Vizio TV in my home office. I mainly use it for Netflix / Hulu / Youtube. the only challenge is that it is a bit slow.. sometime laggy.. but for the price, it is just fine. also, if you are more than 20 ft way from the TV and the Stick is mounted on the back of the TV, your remote might have a hard time connecting with the stick... I will be getting one of these for my daughter when she goes off to college. This way she can have her Youtube and Netflix while she is away from home.
customer_reviews.author: Garnie In Texas

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job of loading Netflex movies very quickly and the picture quality is great. The problem is the remote. It does not work properly. It keeps losing contact with the Roku. I have done everything suggested to correct the problem to no avail. Can't even get a call back or an e-mail from Roku. Although I have had it over a month, I have watched exactly one movie, and even then, I could not pause it or rewind/forward as I had no control with the remote. The point-anywhere remote is an absolute dud. I wouldn't have purchased the 2016 stick if I had known that remote was so difficult to use. Very disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jon from Harrisburg

customer_reviews.title: Huge Pain in the A
customer_reviews.text: Flaky operation. Hadn't used it for a while so plugged it into a tv and it seemed to work great. Connected to prime and started watching a movie but then the remote stopped working. Wouldn't pause or reverse. Tried unplugging USB and power and then performing an actual RESET. That's a huge pain because you have to go back through the entire setup process that seemed to take about 10 min. by the time I looked up old passwords, punch in WIFI connections, etc. Tried connecting my iPhone app and that didn't work. Finally got the roku remote to work and it worked for a while again then stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Problems 7 months in
customer_reviews.text: 7 months in I'm having issues with the picture freezing and the audio continuing. It seems to happen more often when a new episode is starting, or after play has been temporarily stopped, ff, or rew. This happens with both Netflix and HBONow. Also, there are sometimes sharp, loud!, high-pitched sounds that occur over the audio. Sudden and startling, but short. These issues don't occur when I'm streaming those channels from other devices in my home, and the strange sounds don't occur when I am viewing a dvd using the tv (or when I'm streaming stuff from other devices), soooo...it's got to be the stick.
customer_reviews.author: nunaya

customer_reviews.title: Roku support is a disaster
customer_reviews.text: When it worked, it really wasn't a bad device but we had the Streaming stick for about 6 months and it suddenly stopped being able to pick up DLNA sources on our home network. Also have a Premier and an express but those had no issues picking up the same sources. Support at Roku was difficult to reach, slow to respond and, ultimately, unable to provide any sort of solution. Ended up switch to a Fire TV and its been an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Very useful item for streaming
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second place and it came furnished and that included a very large not-smart TV. Since I'm not there often, I didn't want to pay for an internet provider so I bought a mi-fi and this Roku. I only watch Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc., so this small item and the mi-fi give me access to everything I want to watch for little cost. I used a Roku last year while renting a place for the summer and sold it to the landlord after my lease was up. So now I bought one again and am delighted with it again.
customer_reviews.author: Clutter Hater

customer_reviews.title: Best Roku on the market IMO
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Roku stick for my living room, after dealing with the Roku 3 with much success ( It's currently in my moms room). I've even purchased one for a friend. It's way faster than the Roku 3 and I've had no problems with it. There really isn't much to say other than it was a great choice. If you're deciding between this Roku streaming stick an the newer Roku Express, please look no further. I purchased the Roku express from Best Buy, and I'm returning it after 2 days for the streaming stick (Wrote a review for that one too, YIKES). Pay the extra $20, It'll be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: Very cool. No cable TV needed. Just high speed wifi
customer_reviews.text: Glad to have some tv diversity in our house. Admittedly, e are Comcast schmucks. But when we added a new TV, I didn't feel like going thru the agony of another Comcast interaction (aka altercation). So did the research, got a "dumb" tv and added the smaet, Roku stick. It's heavenly. Love being able to binge watch shows on my own time. Can connect into Amazon and Netflix with my pre-existing accounts. No extra fees. #Lovely
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic across the board
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic across the board. Gets a much stronger wireless signal than my Fire TV Stick, speed and video quality is every bit as good as on my Roku 3. The remote is nice and slim, doesn't have any completely useless shortcut buttons unlike other Roku models (*cough*Blockbuster*cough*), and you can even use the Roku app to pipe the audio onto a pair of headphones through your phone (Useful for watching movies late at night without waking the wife/chirrens). Best video streamer for the money, unless you need a hardline Ethernet connection (Roku 3) an/or 4K support (Roku 4). Absolutely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L.

customer_reviews.title: All the Roku you most likely will ever need at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: When I cut the cord, I got this for my kid's room and the Roku Premiere for my room because I pay the bills in this mother and deserve the best! Turns out the joke was on me because this thing does all the things I needed the Premiere to do. If I had to do it over, I would've saved some bucks and just bought a couple of these. My daughter's TV is on the other side of my 1300 sq ft apartment from where my wireless router is located, and it works flawlessly. No real buffering problems at all. Great buy! Happy cord cutting!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth a plugged nickel
customer_reviews.text: You are buying a mere network adapter. You paid your $45 and you just want to use it that is, you do not want nothing to do with that company, Roku. Instead, you cannot just use it: you are required to go online, create an account with them, tell them everything about yourself, such as your name, DOB, gender, email, etc, and after all that they would also want you credit card number. C' mon! All you need it to connect your TV set to the Internet. Such a cheat!
customer_reviews.author: LN

customer_reviews.title: I own 3 Roku products and they all work great. The stick is prefect because the remote is ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the streaming stick because it had the power and features of the top of the line Roku at half the price. I own 3 Roku products and they all work great. The stick is prefect because the remote is RF and not line of sight, so, the stick is in the back of my TV unseen. I have tried a couple of other brands of streaming devices and have found the Roku to access so many channels, many more channels than some of the others. When I travel, I take the stick along and it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flawless performance on two TVs!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my satellite TV with Roku and Amazon Prime. In the last six months I've only had one connection problem that was probably due to a service issue with Roku on one particular day. The rest of the time, both Roku sticks have performed flawlessly and the high definition pictures that I am viewing now are of a higher quality than those that were previously provided by my satellite TV provider. If you have a reliable wireless high-speed Internet connection, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AMZN$Fan

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Functional
customer_reviews.text: For me, this was transformative. I can now stream shows/movies to my bedroom and office TVs, since I already pay for Netflix and Amazon Prime, there is no increase in monthly cost or additional subscription fees to get this content on my large screens or as I am falling asleep at night. I use an antenna for news/sports so I was able to give up cable TV, and save money. Simple to implement, and simple to use. And if I can't find the remote, I just use my phone (via WiFi) to control the Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Apple TV !
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted this to work out! I needed a streaming device that I didn't need to plug into a wall outlet. This worked perfect as it gets it's power from USB port. Perfect!! But!!!! I bought it to view Apple TV on our living room TV. After installing I find out that Apple TV is not available on the Roku Streaming Stick. Apple TV is available on Roku's other devices, but not the streaming stick!! Why not!!! anyway.... love roku... but not this stick...
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Streaming
customer_reviews.text: I got this particular brand of Roku because it has the dedicated Amazon button which works perfectly so far. All my Amazon content is there and easily accessible. It's Youtube interface is better than my Fire stick and I may want to add Youtube tv later. The streaming has been great so far and the quality good. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is the lack of an OFF or even a SLEEP button or setting.
customer_reviews.author: W. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Issue with "retrieving"--check web before purchasing.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this Roku 3600R stick. This thing is constantly in "retrieving" mode. I cannot watch anything on HULU on it. I KNOW my network is capable. I was going to replace a 4 year old Apple TV with ROKU--but the Apple TV works flawlessly. After some wider reading on ROKU "retrieving" I see I am not alone. I tried all the fixes and no, it is NOT the network. Returning with prejudice.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lenehan

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and No Meaningful Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: The power connection is super wonky (regardless of whether you plug it into the tv or the wall). A year ago, I called Roku for support. They sent me another power cord. It was better for a time, though I had to finagle the cord in such a way that created tension to get a suitable connection. Now it only stays on if I torque the back left corner of the stick up by hand- no bueno for a relaxing viewing experience. I tried to contact Roku again, but now you can’t call them. Plus they only do returns for devices you buy directly through them- so if you buy it from Amazon, too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Presets on the remote are NOT cool
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a Roku Premiere+ for the living room and a Roku stick for the bedroom, replacing two Roku 3’s which I love and have served me very well. I cut the DirecTV cord over three years ago and have no regrets. I’ve said many times Roku is the best thing since sliced bread, I love the new stick and Premiere+. However (comma) the “assigned” buttons on remote forces me to remove a star, maybe two. Sorry guys, don’t tell me which services I need quick access to on my remote. The real estate used by these worthless and in-the-way buttons could be better used, user determined presets perhaps?? Other than that, I love my Roku's.
customer_reviews.author: geekdom

customer_reviews.title: I like this better than my fire stick and fire tv.
customer_reviews.text: the menu when in youtube tv was way better than the fire stick and I bought it for that reason alone. however, there are many other features and channels that are also great. i would recommend this over the amazon products for about the same money.
customer_reviews.author: misely

customer_reviews.title: Affordable upgrade for a superior user experience.  Great for any flat screen!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this device so much I bought two! First Device: Family Room I plugged this into the HDMI input on my Xbox One. I use the Xbox One to have a single power-button on/off that synchronizes all inputs/outputs properly. That may sound like over-kill, but to me its worth it. I have found that the user interface for the Xbox One is entirely too sluggish and too unfriendly. Hence, the Roku handles 99% of our daily interactions: Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Video, Google Play, Tablo DVR, etc. Second Device: Man Cave This is straight into an older flat screen. For an affordable upgrade, I now will be able to use this flat screen for another 10-years or more.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the streaming stick to replace my aging Roku 1. I thought about purchasing the express over the streaming stick but decided to go with the new streaming stick and I'm glad I did. Setup was easy. I was able to plug the provided power supply into my USB port and it works perfect. As with any Roku product setup was easy and I was streaming within minutes. The streaming stick definitely has a faster processor that my Roku 1. Netflix and SlingTV stream a lot better with the upgrade. I do prefer the operating system on my Amazon FireStick over Roku
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good for bedroom
customer_reviews.text: Roku streaming stick 2016 model. This is an excellent choice for a bedroom. I’ve been using an older model Roku 2 for my living room. After getting a new tv, I moved the old one to my bedroom and added this streaming stick to watch Netflix and late basketball games. It appears to be much faster than the old device and offers a great picture. I like the feel of the slimmer remote. It doesn’t have the headphone jack, which is fine bc I never used it anyway. It’s powered by usb and hides nicely behind the tv. It also come w a usb plug for charging on the go, should you wish to travel with it.
customer_reviews.author: TheRealMikeZ

customer_reviews.title: Hello Roku, good-by cable TV
customer_reviews.text: Love this, especially at $35 and $40 I paid for two, got another free from Sling. We no longer have cable or FIOS TV, and don't miss it. We do pay for Netflix and Amazon prime, and the $25 Sling package. We use two Rokus at the main house and one Roku at a second house, paying only for the internet at each. The Netflix, Amazon, and Sling don't bill extra for the second house. Antennas on the roof or in the attic at each house get local network TV, and these Roku's fill in the rest, assuming you have broadband wifi. Had one of the remotes fail, Roku promptly sent a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ed & Beth

customer_reviews.title: I had the older model and didn't have any problems ...
customer_reviews.text: I had the older model and didn't have any problems for years! This one seems to over heat and then the remote won't work on it. I thought it was a fluke and notified amazon and they promptly sent me a new one next day free of charge. The only problem is this Roku does the exact same thing. It freezes up and then you have to unplug it for 1-5 minutes and the re-sink the remote to it. It's a pain in the butt. Use a different streaming device!
customer_reviews.author: Rebe

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from previous Roku generations
customer_reviews.text: Moved to this as an upgrade from my old Roku 2. It is a huge upgrade, the previous lag I had in apps, and occasional streaming hiccups (especially with Hulu) are gone. I liked the upgrade so much, I replaced my Chromecast in another room with a second streaming stick. The ability to stream the audio through the Roku app on a smartphone is great as well. I use it when I'm watching TV and my wife is sleeping - no more subtitles!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Chauvet

customer_reviews.title: the remote is wonderful and I LOVE that it has Amazon and Netflix ...
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't stand how our primary roku device didn't automatically play the next episode on Netflix so we got this little thing to use instead. Works perfectly, the remote is wonderful and I LOVE that it has Amazon and Netflix buttons so you don't even have to deal with the main menu.
customer_reviews.author: TiffanyTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after few months of use
customer_reviews.text: Remote stopped working after few months of occasional use. No replacement remote available for the device unless you want to pay close to what it took the whole device to be purchased. Very disappointed! Tried to make it work with app remote but it can't locate it since my stick isn't on my new network and defective remote won't allow me to put it on the new network. Going for Amazon firestick this time with local channels option. I have another roku ultra which is working ok but if firestick does well, roku will be loosing me entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Qureshi

customer_reviews.title: Great Streaming Stick and more powerful features
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this Streaming Stick nearly a month ago and it is working good so far without any issues. It is fast, reliable, user friendly and has more power features. Especially I like the remote very much and it is easy to use. Also, I have ordered a free HDMI extender from Roku website which is really useful. I will surely recommend this Streaming Stick to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Venkat

customer_reviews.title: Works great and the added value if you had Comcast cable ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great and the added value if you had Comcast cable is that you can eliminate one of your additional TV cable boxes. The Xfinity beta app is available on this model so you can return one of your cable boxes and save $9.95 monthly, this ends up paying for itself in about 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Doug P

customer_reviews.title: This little thing is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: It allows you access to more content than one human should ever have. You may never want to leave the house once you dig into the diversity of viewing choices it provides. Good for shut-ins and hermits. I love the RF remote control too. A low price for so much entertainment. It's fast and snappy too (the wi-fi modem and microprocessor).
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: best sreaming dongle. could be better.
customer_reviews.text: this is possibly the best streaming stick out there. the only caveat is that it must use its proprietary remote and even universal remotes cannot control it. the roku boxes are capable of receiving RF signals. the stick is controlled via wifi. i'm still hoping that roku will implement a learning remote feature in their boxes like Apple TV so that you can use your TV remote to control the roku. it won't apply to the stick of course but i would have gladly paid top bucks for this feature. [update 9/27/16] the new set top boxes by roku still don't seem to offer this learning feature. a $30 add-on called sideclick may well be my only option.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective alternative to your cable company's receiver box.
customer_reviews.text: Cost effective alternative to your cable company's receiver box. My only knock on this product is that it does not allow for direct number input into the Spectrum app. It would be nice to be able to go directly to a channel number with a keypad, instead of scrolling through the channel guide. I have a couple of different versions...
customer_reviews.author: K. Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Working great
customer_reviews.text: Took 2 hours rebooting over and over until it finally contacted server and allowed software updates. And my router is a beast, my download around 150 MPS. Not plug and play at all. Tech support was non existent, phone prompts didn't work. If this unit ever works correctly I'll update. I have an old Roku over 5 years old and it never gives me an issue. I figured this dual band should rock, so far it hasn't. Update.. working fine and fast! Network problem in my area was the real issue, revealed by the troublesome stick install. I am very happy with the stick and I'll buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Behr

customer_reviews.title: Small, Useful, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I already had the Roku 3 at home, but I purchased the Roku Streaming Stick so that I could take it with me on vacation. It's small, so it's easy to pack away, it comes with a power cord for the wall, and also a separate small usb plug, so if you have an available usb port in your tv, you can plug it in there to make it easier. The stick does everything the Roku 3 does (except for voice searching). I was able to set it up with the hotel's wifi, and had no problem streaming my shows. Definitely glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: cmcino

customer_reviews.title: Failed.
customer_reviews.text: This lasted less than a year. I had the same problem with the remote that several others had but that is not as bad as the insufficient power issue. The thing is plugged into the wall with the cable and plug that came with it, but it says the TV has insufficient power to operate it. It's not plugged into the TV. A quick search shows this is a common problem with this model. Of course it didn't start happening until after the warranty expired. All tech support said is sorry. Time to try a different brand of streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I spent a little more for this model.
customer_reviews.text: The plug in for our Roku is around the back of the TV. I had another device in the plug and had to get up and walk around and point at it with the remote to get it to read. Paid a little bit extra for this one because it said it would read when out of sight like behind your TV. Works great. Moved the other one to a newer TV that had that plug on the side of the TV so remote could talk to it. Trying to cut the cord. Only one TV is cable now.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie77

customer_reviews.title: Like it better thant he Amazon Fire.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry Amazon Fire, but this is the future of streaming... The Roku works well, and if you have a decent WiFi connection, this stick does the trick. The best part is the Roku has a USB cable, so you plug the Roku into the TV HDMI and then run the USB cable to the TV's USB port for power. Now the Roku is just a part of the TV. Roku comes on and boots up in under 30 seconds when the TV comes on. Then you can add Amazon to the Roku and watch Amazon Prime to your hearts content. Will get more of these as needed...
customer_reviews.author: Zaphod Beeblebrox

customer_reviews.title: Works great near router
customer_reviews.text: I like this stick - BUT, in my small-ish apartment with wifi that works fine on all other devices, this did not get good wifi reception upstairs (wifi is downstairs). I was very frustrated at first and almost returned it, but then switched it to the downstairs TV and moved the regular Roku box upstairs and it works fine now. It has to be close to the wifi router to work well (at least for me). But I've been using this for 5 months and it works wonderfully. Never had an issue, it's smooth and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Freedomride

customer_reviews.title: A Complete POS and a Waste of Money...
customer_reviews.text: This device is a lump of bull feces peddled as a streaming media player. It only works 1/3 of the time and is buggier than a roach motel. This is the second Roku stick I've ordered, btw. The first one had to be returned because it was even worse. The second one I received worked long enough (intermittently for a couple of months) where I'm not able to return it now. I am not a novice when it comes to A/V and computer equipment, and to put it bluntly this is quite simply a crap product. AVOID THIS if you have a brain in your head..
customer_reviews.author: William S. Joyner III

customer_reviews.title: Have become a Roku multi-user
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Roku streaming stick. We have amazon prime, so have access to their video feed, subscribe to Netflix and have a cable service. The roku streaming stick allows us to easily navigate across all three of these as well as some free services as well. The set-up is straight forward but and my wife particularly likes how easy it is to use. It is just much easier than using the native cable controller. While we have cable jacks in most rooms where we have tv's, nevertheless, driving through Roku and being wireless gives us complete freedom on where we place any of our units.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Bierdeman

customer_reviews.title: No more Sony!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this out of frustration with my Sony DVD streaming device. I was chronically unable to stream Netflix and after endless attempts to 'fix' the problem through my ISP, I gave up. I read about the Roku streaming sticks and decided to give it a try. I am SO glad I did. No more dropout and searching for signals during streaming. No more 'unable to stream' messages. I can't believe I waited so long to ditch the Sony device. Roku works perfectly and was a snap to set up, has great picture quality, and I would recommend it to everyone looking for a streaming device.
customer_reviews.author: drcooker

customer_reviews.title: Item dead upon arrival on hold with customer service
customer_reviews.text: Item dead upon arrival on hold with customer service. Was looking forward to getting this set up and running . Call tech-support and after a long hold their asking me for credit card information before they could proceed on troubleshooting this . Sorry I don't think so not when it's dead on arrival . There should be more easy ways to troubleshoot right away and I shouldn't be expected to fork over money on a brand new product that doesn't even work .
customer_reviews.author: NancyGee

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I could possibly say that hasn't already been said but I do love my Roku Stick! We use it solely for traveling, as we have a Roku 3 or 4 attached to all of our TVs at home. We just got back from a Disney World vacation and the Roku Stick worked perfectly! It actually exceeded my expectations. It will live permanently in my suitcase so that I will always have it when I'm away from home. Could not have been easier to get it set up and activated (used my cell phone for activation).
customer_reviews.author: Malinda E. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get set up and works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to get set up and works great. I've got Charter internet, and thanks to this and the Spectrum App, I've got the cheapest scenario of basic cable plus internet that I could find. The great thing about this one is that the remote works on radio waves, so you don't have to point at anything and the stick can be out of sight behind the TV. Mine gets enough power from my Vizio ports to power it so it doesn't have to also be plugged into the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable
customer_reviews.text: We had a Roku 2 that had gotten very slow, YouTube kept crashing, etc. Then it dawned on me: We've had this thing for YEARS. It might be time to upgrade! CNET rated the Roku Streaming Stick the best non-HD streaming dealie, and we have been quite satisfied. Fast, same UI we're used to, remote works in all directions. No complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Skybondsor

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in Time and in perfect state. I live in Colombia, and most of the Channels (Amazon, Hulu, etc) do not work (they dont even appear), just like in a tablet or a smartphone in here. However I use it for Netflix, and also for replicating screen from my Tablet, it works perfectly, its very fast responsive. Video Quality is spectacular (Even better than my other SmartTV), my guess is that it is so fast, that it has video enhancement features. Very happy with it, very good way to avoid trashing your old TV, just wish it would have the Volume buttons with it.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo

customer_reviews.title: Turn your tv into a smart one
customer_reviews.text: I looooove my Roku. I just like how it can brings back an old big plasma TV that now is a smart one. We don't pay cable, just Netflix and Hulu. What I really like about the Roku is that you can have it all, Amazon, Google Play working on the same device. It is fast, and offers tons of free channels like local news, Youtube and more if you really can't afford subscriptions. And when we got it we had a bonus of 2 free months of HBO NOW so we have been able to see Game of Thrones. For me, is the best choice in streaming sticks
customer_reviews.author: Seforah

customer_reviews.title: Customer support is clueless
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing... it's been slow going getting this stick to connect to the Roku server. If everything connects as promised, then you're home free. But if it doesn't, good luck getting help. I finally stumbled upon the idea myself to disable my wireless modem firewall after which the stick connected. My internet works awesome with the firewall on, and I really don't want to run with it off, so I asked Roku what ports or settings the stick requires. They told me to ask my ISP, as if my ISP would have knowledge of their product requirements. As I get time, I'll figure it out eventually.
customer_reviews.author: HomeFixer

customer_reviews.title: It's the best decision I could have made
customer_reviews.text: I had been wanting to get rid of my HIGH TV bill so a friend told me about getting an atenna and then purchasing a ROKU to get even more channels. It's the best decision I could have made. Works great with my Samsung and Vizio TV's and now I only have a 25 dollar a month bill but have Netflix, Hulu, Amazon and I purchase HBO for an extra $5.00. What a difference it has made. Thank you ROKU!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs an updated hulu app
customer_reviews.text: Dont bother if you need multiple for your family to watch hulu.. there arent multiple profiles on the hulu app. Ps4, phone, computer all let ypu switch between user profiles, now my mom is losing my place on vikings.. That (the entire reason I got it) being said the interface is nice, so far it seems quick and responsive. I havent had any problems with the range of the remote. It also auto fits to the screen resolution of a 2007 flatscreen better than the previous bluray player.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Add to your viewing pleasure.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a gadget expert & bought the stick to use for Netflix. It works well but I don't understand why the remote has no on/off switch. I think it must waste power. The gadget is only as good as the signal it receives from your router/internet signal and speed. I never watch movies etc. on computer or magic phone. I only watch on T.V. It works very well for my needs. Generally, I am happy with the model I bought but would probably have chosen a more expensive model if I had known then what I know now.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Clover

customer_reviews.title: Works well for Amazon Prime movies.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this to take advantage of Amazon Prime movies. It works like a charm, although we needed young people to install it. We don't have a smart TV, but this works in an HDMI port with a WiFi extender. Our computer is in another room and the signal didn't go through our plaster walls sufficiently, so the extender was necessary. The remote is easy to understand. We're thinking of eventually subscribing to Hulu to get rid of cable, and this is a start.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Cut the cord and we aren't looking back
customer_reviews.text: We were looking at cutting the cord for a long time. Finally, I took the leap and canceled our cable and my wife bought me this Roku streaming stick for our anniversary. With this, we watch everything from Netflix and Hulu to HBO Go and eventually PlayStation Vue as our substitute for cable. This works great. We used to use a Blu-ray player to watch the streaming networks but it would often stall and lock up. The Roku stick has never locked up and it works like a charm. This is one of the best financial decisions we have ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn S. Lealos

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with ROKU
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd ROKU streaming stick.. In the last 10 years I have purchased 4 ROKU media boxes, I have one on every TV in my home. The ROKU interface is far and away the best. ROKU is quality and dependable. The ROKU stick I have now is about 60 feet away from my Netgear wireless router and I rarely have a streaming issue such as lag or won't connect. A simple restart always solves that problem anyway. I would highly recommend any ROKU product.
customer_reviews.author: wolfie

customer_reviews.title: ... my second stick within less than a month and like others the stick keeps freezing
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second stick within less than a month and like others the stick keeps freezing, even the new one I have had less than 24 hours froze and all I could do was unplug it. This is the worst piece of technology I have purchased in a very, very long time! Clearly it is not fit for purpose and there is no way of turning it off without unplugging it. It is going back today!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Revell

product_meta.title: Roku Streaming Stick (3600R) - HD Streaming Player with Quad-Core Processor
product_meta.description: Get big streaming power in a pocket sized, easy to use stick. The 2016 Roku Streaming Stick delivers fast performance with a quad core processor and dual band wireless. Device works with all top movie and TV streaming services, including Amazon Instant Video, VUDU, Google Play, Netflix, Hulu, HBO, and 3,000 more channels. Access 300,000+ movies and TV episodes plus music, sports, games, international content, and kids' programming. Unbiased search across top channels shows you where content is free or cheapest to watch. And because Roku Streaming Stick is portable, you can stream to different HDTVs in your home, dorm, or hotel room. The Roku Streaming Stick delivers fast performance with a quad core processor and dual band wireless. Simple. Access your own subscriptions like Amazon Instant Video, VUDU, Google Play, Netflix, or Hulu. Rent or buy on demand, and enjoy hundreds of free channels. Save time and money with search results that show you where movies and TV shows are free or cheapest to watch. Totally portable, and streams to different HDTVs in your home, dorm, or hotel room. Private listening via mobile. Use your smartphone or tablet and the Roku mobile app for iOS and Android to enjoy private listening anytime via your Bluetooth or plug in headphones. Mobile control transforms your iOS or Android mobile device into a Roku remote, search with voice or text, and send photos, video or music, to your TV from your phone or tablet.
feature_bullets: Powerful quad core processor & best wireless performance
Voice remote with TV power & volume
Easy to use remote, intuitive navigation, search across top channels
With headphones for private listening & lost remote finder
Free mobile app for iOS or android
